death.attack.grinder: %1$s fell into a DANDYCORP Industrial Grinder™!
ui.dccobblemon.vendor.retire_kick: DANDYCORP wishes you the best in your permanent leave. Goodbye!
death.attack.vendor: %1$s took the only escape route DANDYCORP provides.
dccobblemon.ponder.grinder_grind.text_1: The DANDYCORP Industrial Grinder™ turns junk into tickets.
dccobblemon.ponder.grinder_grind.text_2: The grinder requires at least 32RPM to operate.
dccobblemon.ponder.grinder_grind.text_3: Items can be input via the top of the grinder...
dccobblemon.ponder.grinder_grind.text_5: Tickets can be automatically exported through the back
dccobblemon.ponder.grinder_grind.text_6: * DANDYCORP is not liable for any injuries or casualties caused by improper use of The DANDYCORP Industrial Grinder™!
dccobblemon.ponder.grinder_points.text_1: The faster the grinder spins, the faster its items are processed.
dccobblemon.ponder.grinder_points.text_2: Each item added to the grinder has a unique point value.
dccobblemon.ponder.grinder_points.text_3: This value can be found by inspecting an item in your inventory [U]
dccobblemon.ponder.grinder_points.text_4: Not all items have a ticket value, though.
dccobblemon.ponder.grinder_points.text_5: An item that is enchanted has its value increased by 5% per enchant level.
dccobblemon.ponder.grinder_points.text_6: Once the grinder reaches 2000 points, a ticket will be produced.
dccobblemon.ponder.grinder_points.text_7: Goggles will show you how close your grinder is to producing a ticket.
dccobblemon.ponder.grinder_points.text_8: Tickets can be spent at your local DANDYCORP Vendor™!
